channel.title: Looking for a Dev Team to join
channel.description:
Im looking to join a team of programmers/developers. im not experienced in one particular area as i know server languages, here are some:
C++ Java Web Dev ( Package of: HTML, CSS, XML, jQuery, JavaScript, Ajax, PHP, MySQL) .NET (1.0 - 4.5)
My details are as follows: Name: Kieran Devlin Age: 16 *almost 17* Nationality: British Location: UK Years programming: 6 or 7.
Main reason for joining a team: Just tired of coding alone. Also i want to see other peoples projects and idea's and help out any way i can :)
If you think you could use me, please message me on skype: exotiicdeath. *Note: please dont add me if your just looking to start a team as im wanting to join an existing team.

add my skype: Mattredd9395 if u wanna join my team?

item.title: Looking for a Dev Team to join
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:6, topic:507434”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=625667.msg4258064#msg4258064 date=1363117570]

i know server languages

HTML, CSS, XML, jQuery, JavaScript, Ajax, PHP, MySQL

Everything in bold isn’t a language, lol
[/quote]
HTML isn’t?[/quote]
For all intents and purposes HTML isn’t a programming language, HTML5 is closer to a programming language, for example it’s used in the creation of android apps but once again still isn’t a programming language, it’s still defined as a markup language :P.

Read full topic

item.source: Looking for a Dev Team to join

item.title: Looking for a Dev Team to join
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

[quote=“Bellend, post:3, topic:507434”][quote author=Flame_ link=topic=625667.msg4258046#msg4258046 date=1363116822]
Naming languages isn’t going to get you very far.
Show some tutorials you’ve written, past or current works, or if you don’t have access to any, use your programming skills to whip up some for us.
Otherwise, good luck finding a team.
[/quote]

Well most of my big work is private or for personal use. but if you really want to see if i suggest messaging me on skype, i’d have no problem screen sharing.
Also, il think you will find that this is what you would do in real life when you go for a job interview. you don’t show your future boss how good you can fly an airplane if your wanting to be a pilot. your CV will tell them your skills. So if you really want to see some proof of my work before you let me join, quite clearly your only a kiddi trying to get free developers. because any real dev team would let you work, if you false-claimed you could program then you would just get kicked out of the team. so i have no reason to lie about the skills i know because #1 im not an immature ‘kiddi’ and #2 it would be a huge waste of my time.[/quote]
But you show papers, qualifications, and anything else pertaining to your applications that would help further influence your probability to be accepted into a team.
This is just my opinion on the matter; as I said before, best of in luck finding a team.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a Dev Team to join

item.title: Looking for a Dev Team to join
item.dc:creator: @Bellend Bellend
item.description:
@Bellend wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:2, topic:507434”]Naming languages isn’t going to get you very far.
Show some tutorials you’ve written, past or current works, or if you don’t have access to any, use your programming skills to whip up some for us.
Otherwise, good luck finding a team.[/quote]

Well most of my big work is private or for personal use. but if you really want to see if i suggest messaging me on skype, i’d have no problem screen sharing.
Also, il think you will find that this is what you would do in real life when you go for a job interview. you don’t show your future boss how good you can fly an airplane if your wanting to be a pilot. your CV will tell them your skills. So if you really want to see some proof of my work before you let me join, quite clearly your only a kiddi trying to get free developers. because any real dev team would let you work, if you false-claimed you could program then you would just get kicked out of the team. so i have no reason to lie about the skills i know because #1 im not an immature ‘kiddi’ and #2 it would be a huge waste of my time.

Read full topic
